query: Investigate Ali Khaledi Nasab an Irani AI Researcher working for Amazon
tasks: Search LinkedIn for current role and professional details of Ali Khaledi Nasab at Amazon
Check Iranian academic publication databases for research papers or academic profiles
Search Iranian news websites and media archives for mentions of Ali Khaledi Nasab in AI research context
Investigate Google Scholar for academic publications related to AI research by this individual
Search Iranian professional networking sites like Jobinja for career history or professional connections
Check conference proceedings and tech event archives for presentations or speaking engagements in AI field
Search Iranian company registration databases for potential business affiliations or startup involvement
Review technical conference websites and AI research symposium participant lists for professional credentials

task_1.query_used: Search LinkedIn for current role and professional details of Ali Khaledi Nasab at Amazon
task_1.data: Ali Khaledi Nasab is a physicist and AI scientist currently working at Amazon Rufus. Originally from Iran, he moved to the United States in 2014 to pursue his Ph.D. After completing his doctorate, he joined Stanford University's Department of Neurosurgery, focusing on developing stimulation methods for treating neurological disorders. In 2021, he transitioned to CODA Biotherapeutics, a gene therapy startup targeting epilepsy treatments. Following the company's closure in 2022 due to funding challenges, he joined Amazon as a research scientist in the AWS network capacity team. In 2024, he moved to Amazon Rufus to work on their latest Generative AI product. Throughout his career, Khaledi Nasab has been involved in various research projects, including studying the dynamics of excitable tree networks and exploring methods to depolarize echo chambers in social networks. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai), [export.arxiv.org](https://export.arxiv.org/abs/2101.04079?utm_source=openai))

citations.title: [2101.04079] Depolarization of echo chambers by random dynamical nudge

task_2.query_used: Check Iranian academic publication databases for research papers or academic profiles
task_2.data:
Ali Khaledi Nasab is a physicist specializing in the dynamics of excitable networks, particularly in sensory neurons with tree-like structures. He earned his Ph.D. in Physics and Astronomy from Ohio University, where he conducted research on the dynamics of excitable tree networks, focusing on sensory neurons with myelinated terminals. His work aimed to understand the mechanisms of spike generation and information coding in these neurons. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2019/05/khaledi-nasab-receives-aps-travel-award-to-attend-conference/?utm_source=openai))

In 2019, Khaledi Nasab received the American Physical Society (APS) Division of Biological Physics Student Travel Award, which supported his attendance at the APS annual meeting in Boston, where he presented his research. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2019/05/khaledi-nasab-receives-aps-travel-award-to-attend-conference/?utm_source=openai))

Prior to his doctoral studies, he completed his undergraduate education at the University of Tabriz in Iran. His academic profile indicates a strong publication record, with 23 papers, 426 citations, and an h-index of 10, reflecting his active engagement in research. ([exaly.com](https://exaly.com/author/5034433/ali-khaledi-nasab?utm_source=openai))

After completing his Ph.D., Khaledi Nasab continued his research as a senior researcher at Amazon in Seattle, United States. ([loop.frontiersin.org](https://loop.frontiersin.org/people/1085546/publications?utm_source=openai))

In addition to his scientific work, Khaledi Nasab has been involved in discussions on the challenges faced by international students in the U.S. In 2017, he authored an article titled "Standing up to fear," published in the journal Science, where he shared his experiences and the difficulties encountered by international students during the Trump administration's travel ban. ([academia.edu](https://www.academia.edu/32689067/Standing_up_to_fear?utm_source=openai))

While specific publications by Khaledi Nasab may not be readily available in Iranian academic databases, his contributions to the field of physics and his active participation in international scientific communities are well-documented.

citations.title: Khaledi Nasab Receives APS Travel Award to Attend Conference - Ohio University | College of Arts & Sciences
Khaledi Nasab Receives APS Travel Award to Attend Conference - Ohio University | College of Arts & Sciences

task_3.query_used: Search Iranian news websites and media archives for mentions of Ali Khaledi Nasab in AI research context
task_3.data:
Ali Khaledi-Nasab is an Iranian researcher affiliated with Amazon, specializing in machine learning, artificial intelligence, networks, computational neuroscience, and nonlinear dynamics. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai)) His work has been cited in various scientific publications, including studies on the synthesis of ZnO nanoparticles and the optical properties of quantum dots. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

However, there is no specific information available regarding his contributions to AI research within Iranian news sources.

task_4.query_used: Investigate Google Scholar for academic publications related to AI research by this individual
task_4.data:
Ali Khaledi-Nasab is a researcher with a diverse academic background, contributing to fields such as machine learning, artificial intelligence, and nonlinear dynamics. His work spans various applications, including quantum dot physics, neural network dynamics, and the development of electrochemical sensors.

In the realm of quantum dot physics, Khaledi-Nasab co-authored a study titled "Size-dependent intersubband optical properties of dome-shaped InAs/GaAs quantum dots with wetting layer," published in 2012. This research investigates the optical properties of quantum dots, which are crucial for advancements in optoelectronic devices. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

In the field of nonlinear dynamics, he collaborated on a paper titled "Long-Lasting Desynchronization of Plastic Neural Networks by Double-Random Coordinated Reset Stimulation," published in 2022. This study explores the effects of coordinated reset stimulation on neural networks, with potential applications in neuroscience and neuroengineering. ([scholar.google.com](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Ash32BAAAAAJ&utm_source=openai))

Additionally, Khaledi-Nasab has been involved in the development of electrochemical aptasensors for the detection of neurodegenerative diseases, cancer, and coronavirus. These AI-optimized sensors aim to provide stable and reproducible detection methods, highlighting his contributions to healthcare technology. ([pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov](https://pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/articles/PMC11742820/?utm_source=openai))

Overall, Ali Khaledi-Nasab's academic publications reflect a strong focus on applying artificial intelligence and machine learning techniques to various scientific and engineering challenges.

task_5.query_used: Search Iranian professional networking sites like Jobinja for career history or professional connections
task_5.data:
Ali Khaledi Nasab is an Iranian physicist and AI scientist currently based in the San Francisco Bay Area. He earned his Ph.D. in Physics from Ohio University, where he conducted research on the collective dynamics of excitable tree networks. Following his doctoral studies, he worked at Stanford University's Department of Neurosurgery, focusing on stimulation methods for treating neurological disorders. In 2021, he joined CODA Biotherapeutics, a gene therapy startup, as a scientist. In 2022, he transitioned to Amazon, where he currently serves as a research scientist in the AWS network capacity planning organization. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

In addition to his professional roles, Ali has been involved in various scientific projects and publications. Notably, he edited the Brain Development section of the "Encyclopedia of Child and Adolescent Health," which received the 2024 PROSE Award for significant contributions in Clinical Medicine. He has also published research on topics such as the dynamics of phase oscillator networks and the depolarization of echo chambers by random dynamical nudge. ([alikhaledi.com](https://www.alikhaledi.com/?utm_source=openai))

Ali maintains an active presence in the scientific community, sharing insights and updates on his personal website and Medium blog. His work reflects a strong commitment to advancing research in physics, neuroscience, and artificial intelligence.

He earned his Ph.D. in Physics and Astronomy from Ohio University, where he conducted research on the dynamics of excitable tree networks, particularly in sensory neurons. In 2019, he received the American Physical Society's Division of Biological Physics Student Travel Award, which supported his presentation at the APS annual meeting in Boston. ([ohio-forum.com](https://www.ohio-forum.com/2019/05/khaledi-nasab-receives-aps-travel-award-to-attend-conference/?utm_source=openai))

His academic contributions are documented in his Google Scholar profile, which lists several publications in the fields of machine learning, artificial intelligence, networks, computational neuroscience, and nonlinear dynamics. Currently, he is affiliated with Amazon, where he continues to apply his expertise in machine learning and artificial intelligence.

report:
## OSINT Intelligence Report: Ali Khaledi Nasab

**Report Date:** June 13, 2025

### Executive Summary
Ali Khaledi Nasab is an Iranian physicist and AI scientist currently working at Amazon Rufus. He has a Ph.D. in Physics and Astronomy from Ohio University and previously worked at Stanford University. His research interests include machine learning, artificial intelligence, networks, computational neuroscience, and nonlinear dynamics.

### Key Intelligence by Category

**1. Career / Employment**
- Currently works at Amazon Rufus as a physicist and AI scientist.
- Previously worked at Stanford University's Department of Neurosurgery, focusing on developing stimulation methods.

**2. Financial / Corporate Ties**
- Affiliated with Amazon through his current employment.

**3. Legal / Regulatory Issues**
- No information available.

**4. Academic / Public Presence**
- Holds a Ph.D. in Physics and Astronomy from Ohio University.
- Research interests include machine learning, artificial intelligence, networks, computational neuroscience, and nonlinear dynamics.
- Has publications in areas such as quantum dot physics, neural network dynamics, and electrochemical systems.
- Received an APS travel award to attend a conference.

**5. Online / Social Media**
- Has a personal website: alikhaledi.com.
- Has a Google Scholar profile.

**6. Additional Observations**
- Originally from Iran, moved to the United States in 2014.
- Currently based in the San Francisco Bay Area.

### Risk Score
Low. Ali Khaledi Nasab appears to be a researcher and scientist with no readily apparent reputational risks. His affiliations with reputable institutions like Amazon and Stanford, along with his academic achievements, suggest a low-risk profile.

flagged_issues: Minor timeline inconsistency: report states he joined Amazon in 2022, but one source indicates he was already a 'senior researcher at Amazon in Seattle' after completing his Ph.D. (which appears to be before 2019)
Missing specific publication details that are mentioned in retrieval evidence but not included in report
No mention of his 2017 Science article 'Standing up to fear' about international student challenges
No mention of his editorial work on the Encyclopedia of Child and Adolescent Health that won a 2024 PROSE Award
judgement.revised_report:
## OSINT Intelligence Report: Ali Khaledi Nasab

**Report Date:** June 13, 2025

### Executive Summary
Ali Khaledi Nasab is an Iranian physicist and AI scientist currently working at Amazon Rufus. He has a Ph.D. in Physics and Astronomy from Ohio University and previously worked at Stanford University. His research interests include machine learning, artificial intelligence, networks, computational neuroscience, and nonlinear dynamics.

### Key Intelligence by Category

**1. Career / Employment**
- Currently works at Amazon Rufus as a physicist and AI scientist (moved to this role in 2024)¹
- Previously worked at Amazon AWS network capacity team as a research scientist (joined 2022)¹
- Worked at CODA Biotherapeutics, a gene therapy startup targeting epilepsy treatments (2021-2022, company closed due to funding challenges)¹
- Previously worked at Stanford University's Department of Neurosurgery, focusing on developing stimulation methods for treating neurological disorders¹
- Note: Some sources indicate he may have been affiliated with Amazon as a senior researcher earlier than 2022²

**2. Financial / Corporate Ties**
- Affiliated with Amazon through his current employment
- Previously affiliated with CODA Biotherapeutics (now closed)

**3. Legal / Regulatory Issues**
- No information available

**4. Academic / Public Presence**
- Holds a Ph.D. in Physics and Astronomy from Ohio University²
- Undergraduate education completed at the University of Tabriz in Iran²
- Research interests include machine learning, artificial intelligence, networks, computational neuroscience, and nonlinear dynamics³
- Has 23 papers, 426 citations, and an h-index of 10²
- Notable publications include:
  - "Size-dependent intersubband optical properties of dome-shaped InAs/GaAs quantum dots with wetting layer" (2012)⁴
  - "Long-Lasting Desynchronization of Plastic Neural Networks by Double-Random Coordinated Reset Stimulation" (2022)⁴
  - Research on depolarization of echo chambers by random dynamical nudge¹
- Received APS Division of Biological Physics Student Travel Award in 2019²
- Edited the Brain Development section of the "Encyclopedia of Child and Adolescent Health," which received the 2024 PROSE Award for significant contributions in Clinical Medicine⁵
- Authored "Standing up to fear" in Science journal (2017) about challenges faced by international students during Trump administration's travel ban²
- Involved in development of AI-optimized electrochemical aptasensors for detection of neurodegenerative diseases, cancer, and coronavirus⁴

**5. Online / Social Media**
- Has a personal website: alikhaledi.com¹⁵
- Has a Google Scholar profile³⁴
- Maintains a Medium blog⁵

**6. Additional Observations**
- Originally from Iran, moved to the United States in 2014¹
- Currently based in the San Francisco Bay Area⁵
- Has been actively involved in discussions about international student experiences in the U.S.²

### Risk Score
Low. Ali Khaledi Nasab appears to be a well-established researcher and scientist with no readily apparent reputational risks. His affiliations with reputable institutions like Amazon and Stanford, along with his academic achievements and award-winning editorial work, suggest a low-risk profile.

### Citations
¹ Task 1 retrieval evidence (alikhaledi.com, export.arxiv.org)
² Task 2 retrieval evidence (ohio-forum.com, exaly.com, loop.frontiersin.org, academia.edu)
³ Task 3 retrieval evidence (scholar.google.com)
⁴ Task 4 retrieval evidence (scholar.google.com, pmc.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov)
⁵ Task 5 retrieval evidence (alikhaledi.com)
